citations.narrative:
A female beagle (ID#1223812) had a fresh wound on the medial surface of the right forefoot, and a fresh puncture wound
on the upper surface of the left forearm. This dog was housed with two other beagles, and bowls of food were present. A
sign on the front of the enclosure stated that "12238212 has been food aggressive with old pen mates" and recommended
feeding her separately. Dogs with a history of food aggression should not be fed as part of a group. The beagle's wounds
must be treated by a licensed veterinarian, and she should be fed separately from the other dogs from this point on.
Correct by: 6 June 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.7  Direct
   
Compatible grouping.

feeding her separately. Dogs with a history of food aggression should not be fed as part of a group. The beagle's wounds
